events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th involving their sedan and a truck at an intersection.
After review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to involvement of insured vehicle in a collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and reached out to the customer promptly.
Acknowledgment of the submitted claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and initiation of the review process.
The customer was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and proof of insurance coverage.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including damage photos and official accident report for claim processing.
The investigation team began assessing the vehicle damage and reviewing police documentation to determine fault.
Investigation was concluded confirming the accident details and liability as described in the initial claim.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repair costs and rental reimbursement was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal expressing satisfaction with the timely resolution.
Claim was officially approved by the insurance company authorizing payment disbursement for the repairs.
Insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop to cover the costs detailed in the approved settlement.
The auto accident claim was closed after confirmation that all repairs were completed and payment was received.
The claim files and all related documents were archived in the company database following claim closure.
